Turn a programming project into a corpus

construct_a_corpus.Rmd

Constructing your corpus

codexplor offering functions to turn a programming project into a corpus by providing folder(s) path(s) and/or github repo(s).

corpus <- codexplor::construct_corpus("~", "tidyverse/stringr", languages = "R")
nrow(corpus); length(unique(corpus$matches)) # content + a 1st matched pattern

By default construct_corpus is tunned for the R programming language. One or several languages could be passed to construct_corpus, e.g., in order to read the programming files accordingly to their extensions.

  • construct_corpus return the full content as a df. Some 1st matches are realized : the names of functions defined in the files of the project are extracted in a column of the returned df. It’s assumed that no file have several function within the same line, otherwise lines of the returned df will be duplicated. This matching of functions names rely on a regex, for each of the languages supported by construct_corpus (i.e. R, Python, JavaScript, Java, C, Cpp, Go).

Developed by Clément Laverdet.

Site built with pkgdown 2.1.1.
